info.label: Application Security Engineer
info.brief: A multi-faceted flexible application security engineer.

employment.summary: 10+ years industry IT and software development, security experience.

history.summary: Performing web, network, and mobile penetration tests and secure code review for a variety of platforms and applications. Guiding clients in application security tasks like threat modelling, secure design and vulnerability remediation and scoring. Owning team resources like test plans, payload databases. Mentoring team members in penetration testing.
highlights: Delivered high quality reports to clients containing many critical and high severity vulnerabilities for a diverse set of applications and products.
Advised client developer teams on threat modeling, secure design/architecture, and risk classification
Performed quality control on outgoing client reports for the entire team.

history.summary: A broad role covering both software development and application security tasks. Writing code focused around the Node.JS stack. Performing web application penetration tests and secure code review for a variety of platforms and applications. Some example applications include:
highlights: Messaging Application - Performed a security assessment on the application using code review combined with penetration testing techniques to find vulnerabilities in the application. Used: Burp, Zap, nmap, Nessus, Brakeman, kali

Content Management System - Performed a security assessment on the application using code review combined with penetration testing techniques to find vulnerabilities in the application. Used: Burp, Zap, nmap, Nessus, Brakeman, kali
Artwork Sharing and Hosting - Performed a security assessment on the application using penetration testing techniques to find vulnerabilities in the application. Used: Burp, Zap, nmap, Nessus, kali

Professional Membership Application - Performed a security assessment on the application using code review combined with penetration testing techniques to find vulnerabilities in the application. Used: Burp, Zap, nmap, Nessus, Checkmarx, kali

Supply Chain Management - Performed a security assessment on the application using code review combined with penetration testing techniques to find vulnerabilities in the application. Used: Burp, Zap, nmap, Nessus

history.summary: Building internal tools in support of analytics and business requirements. Releasing visualizations for external consumption.
highlights: Created and launched multiple web visualizations to production.
Built to completion, internal statistics tracking web application.

history.summary: Building internal tools and production websites using Java and Web Technologies.
highlights: Managed software development and upgrades of doctor facing documentation website.
Learned Objective C and the iOS framework, to add features and fix bugs on the XE.com iPhone and iPad applications.
Fixed and added changes to a Java based web service that supported the mobile applications.
Released a new version to the app store
Developed a JSF component library, jQueryFaces, using jQuery and released the under MIT & GPL license on SourceForge.
Developed a web app using ColdFusion and ExtJS that updated an XML file using AJAX.
Worked with other departments creating HTML content from PDF files.
Developed a ColdFusion script that would sync files and folders on the server.

history.title: Computer Science, Honours, Co-operative Program
history.summary: Completion of a Computer Science focused education.
curriculum: Advanced Offerings in Computer Science - Machine Learning

list.name: Linux
list.summary: Managing production and staging servers and using as a desktop operating system.

list.name: OSX
list.summary: Using daily as a development platform.

writing.title: The Rise of JavaScript XSS and Practical Mitigation Techniques
Setting up a Secure Instance of Express JS (GitHub Repo)
Security Comparison: AngularJS vs Backbone.js vs Ember
